title: Multithreaded Web Scraper
body: A web app encouraging users to flex both their muscles and their brains. The concept was to create a mobile app that would allow people to explore their communities and make geolocation art by placing pins at their location and connecting to other pins.

title: Simple Paint Application
body: A basic recreation of Microsoft Paint using OpenGL, GLEW, and GLFW. It allows the user to draw on a canvas using different colors, brush shapes, and brush sizes.

title: Pen Runners
body: A web app encouraging users to flex both their muscles and their brains. The concept was to create a mobile app that would allow people to explore their communities and make geolocation art by placing pins at their location and connecting to other pins.

title: Portfolio in React
body: The website you are currently visiting. This is a revision of a previous portofolio website with more creativity and better design. I also plan to host more creative coding/animations on this page in the near future.

title: Toy Tetris
body: An implementation of the famous game of Tetris using the Simple and Fast Multimedia Library (SFML) in C++. A fun side project of practicing using Object Oriented Design to construct a game.

title: Aggie Honor Bot
body: A project from TAMUhack 2020 where my team implemented my idea of a GroupMe bot that encourages academic integrity in class group chats. Utilized the GroupMe API to monitor chatrooms and protect students from other's academic dishonesty.

title: Data Structures and Algorithms
body: My implementation of several data structures and algorithms in C++. From stacks and priority queues to hash tables and self-balancing BSTs, we were tasked with implementing these data structures from scratch using C++

title: Football Statistics Database Application
body: A group project in which we used Java to create a GUI application that interfaced with a PostgreSQL database in order to query data in order to answer questions from the past 7 years of College Football statistics
